title: Presidential Action Modifying the Scope of the Reciprocal Tariff for Certain Agricultural Products
summary: This presidential action utilizes authorities under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and provisions of the Trade Act of 1974 to modify the scope of the reciprocal tariff program as it applies to a defined set of agricultural products.

title: Proclamation by the President on Veterans Day, 2025
summary: This presidential proclamation designates Veterans Day 2025 as an occasion to honor and reflect on the service and sacrifices of United States veterans. It acknowledges the nearly 250-year history of veterans' contributions to national security, liberty, and the American way of life. The proclamation emphasizes recognizing veterans and their families, remembering those who have fallen, and supporting veterans through observances and programs. It invites public expression of appreciation and service, and calls for appropriate ceremonies and actions to uphold the well-being of veterans.

title: Proclamation on the 250th Anniversary of the Founding of the United States Marine Corps
summary: The President proclaims the 250th anniversary of the founding of the United States Marine Corps, recognizing two and a half centuries of service and the corps' role in national security. The proclamation notes the Marine Corps' values of courage, discipline, and unity and traces its history from the nation's founding to present-day challenges. It acknowledges Marines, their families, and veterans for their service and sacrifices and designates commemorative activities and educational programs across federal, state, and local levels to honor the anniversary, while directing government departments and agencies to support such observances and to preserve the history and traditions of the Marine Corps.

title: Nomination of Jared Isaacman to be Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Sent to Senate
summary: The White House announced that Jared Isaacman, a resident of Pennsylvania, has been nominated to serve as Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, to succeed Bill Nelson, who has resigned from the position. The nomination has been transmitted to the Senate for consideration.

title: Proclamation Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates Under the U.S.-China Economic and Trade Arrangement
summary: This presidential proclamation exercises authorities under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and section 604 of the Trade Act of 1974 to modify reciprocal tariff rates in accordance with the bilateral economic and trade arrangement between the United States and the People's Republic of China. The action cites the legal bases for the measures and describes the scope and effect of the tariff adjustments as part of implementing the bilateral framework.

title: Presidential Action Modifying Duties to Address the Synthetic Opioid Supply Chain in the People's Republic of China
summary: Under the authority vested in the President by the U.S. Constitution and law, including the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and section 604 of the Trade Act of 1974, this action modifies existing duties on certain goods imported from the People's Republic of China. The modifications are intended to address elements of the synthetic opioid supply chain by adjusting tariffs on goods involved in the production and distribution of synthetic opioids. The action identifies the scope of the modified duties, assigns responsibility for implementation and enforcement to relevant federal agencies, and specifies any transitional provisions and the effective date. This action reflects a use of import duties to influence the synthetic opioid supply chain under the cited authorities.
